title: What is the best weight loss diet? - Quora

response.answer_text: The question should have been what is the best weight loss diet for you. Let me give you an example. I ask you to complete reading 50 pages of a draft and also I ask three of your friends to do the same and also prepare a report. Will all of you give me the same report with the same word tot wor and submit it at the same time? No, right. The same is with our bodies and diet. Our gut health plays an important role and so do our genes, our level of activity, and the food we put into our bodies. Let me make it simple for you. I will suggest a few diets. Follow these to the point and mention your results in the comment section below. Also, it takes a lot of effort to, so do click on the like button. It inspires us to write more content. CHOOSE THE ONE which your body accepts. Some diets can cause severe headaches and fatigue, be careful and if you feel so, just stop the diet. Along with the diet, add 40–60 minutes of exercise every day for good results - the exercise is of your choice. P.S: Always consult a physician before starting such diets. People with certain MEDICAL CONDITIONS should not attempt to do such diets as they can be life-threatening. When the physician says yes, go ahead with them.This is not professional or medical advice, always ask your doctor for the best result.The Egg Diet:I personally did this and lost a ton of weight. But let me be honest and list the pros and cons.Pros: Super fast weight loss, the body starts getting into shape, immediate results.Cons: severe hunger pangs, stomach pain, you end up dreaming about food, your legs will ache, hair loss might happen - so use a multivitamin tablet.Diet 1: The Boiled Egg DIETBreakfast: Brown Bread - 4 slices for men, 2 slices for women, boiled Egg whites - 4 or 6 (you can even way 8 if you wish, but only egg whites)Lunch: Brown Bread - 2 slices, boiled egg whites - 2 to 4Evening snack - Boiled egg whites - 2Dinner - Brown bread - 1 slice, boiled egg whites - 2 to 4You can add any number of boiled egg whites you want, but the brown bread should be as mentioned. Add 100 ml of curd in 1 litre of water and sip in between if you feel like, You can have lemon water but no sugar allowed. That is it, no salad, nothing. Follow this diet to the dot and let me know the results.Weight lost in a month - 14 kg (also I did 2 hours of intense workout in the gym under a personal trainer, so guarantee similar results, but you will see amazing results).THE VEG DIET:I also did this diet and found some great results. though not as fast the egg diet, this diet gives amazing results too.Pros: Sustained weight loss, you are full and not much hunger pangsCons: Hunger pangs do strike you at times, headaches, restlessnessDiet 2:Breakfast: Idli - 2(40 grams each), dosa - 2( 2 ladles full for two dosas), Poha, Upma, Vermicelli - 1 cup, Chapati and a bowl of curry - 1 (30 grams)Lunch: Brown rice or Millets or Chapati - 60 grams, 1 cup of vegetable curry, 1 cup of curdEvening snack - Orange or Guava or any seasonal fruit - 1, Almonds - 10Dinner - Millets or brown rice or Chapati - 40 grams, vegetable curry - 1 bowlOil: Use only 15 grams in the entire day for cooking. Distribute it as you want but not a drop moreWeight lost in a month: Lost 6 kg with HIIT exercises and this time guided by an online fitness coach.THE INDIAN KETO DIET:I also did this diet and found some incredible results. Though not as fast the egg diet, this diet gives amazing results too.Pros: Super fast weight loss, you will feel weight loss around the tummy. you will feel light.Cons: Hunger pangs do strike you at times, headaches, initially restlessness and irritation will rule the dayDiet 3:Breakfast: Paneer - 100gms, Oil - 10 gms, Onions and Chili - 20 gmLunch: Chicken Legs - 200 gm, Oil - 10 gm, Masalas for cooking(use in moderation)Evening snack - Almonds - 10Dinner - Egg whites - 3 or Paneer -100 gm, White Rice - 40 gm, Dal -20 gm, Oil -10 gm. Onions and Chili - 20 gmFollow it to the dot and let me know the results.Weight lost in a week : 4 kg(did 2 hours of gym under a personal trainer)THE VERSATILE VICKY EGG DIET:I did this diet and found some great results. I have been taking several diets for weight loss for the past several years. With 149 cm high, I went from 54 kg to 48 kg. So, I would like to give some of my own perspectives about those diets: Totally recommend: Low - carb, Eat Clean and Intermittent Fasting - good for weight loss, overall health and life quality. Until now, my diet is kind of a mix between the three. Recommend for those who want to lose much fat, stubborn fat: KETO diet Don’t recommend: GM diet General Motor Diet (GM diet)It was about a year and a half ago, I found out this diet while surfing internet. I was so obsessed with my weight loss and decided to try for one week. And I would never ever do it again after that 7 - day GM diet. You can google for more details. It is kind of diet that you consume mostly fruits and vegetables with almost no protein and very little carbs in a course of 7 days. I was not going to work at that time, just staying at home. That’s why I can applied this one. I feel no energy at all, continuously feeling hungry. And I just lost 0.4 kg after 7 days and gain back soon after back to normal diet the following week. Sounds funny. I don’t recommend this one for those who want to have a long - term plan to reach an ideal weight. 2. KETO diet I tried KETO diet in a course of 10 days. I lost 1,5 kg, mostly my stubborn fat - arms, thighs and upper belly. I totally recommend this diet to those who is struggling to lose a lot of fat or very very stubborn fat. I don’t recommend this diet for those who just want to lose from 1 - 3 kg. And I don’t favor this one as a daily diet in the long run. I already wrote a detail answer about side effects of KETO , you can find here for more information. Compared to other diets, I see KETO is a bit easier to apply if you cannot cook everyday and cannot keep a regular schedule. With KETO , you can still go out, choosing dishes that doesn’t contain carbs and sugar. 3. Intermittent Fasting - IF Among the six ways to do IF, I choose 8/16 because it can fit my schedule and workloads. I eat for 8 hours and fasting the remaining 16 hours of the day. The principle of IF is when you fast, the HGH - Human Growth Hormone will soar, around 5 times as usual, helping the body to lose fat and increase muscle. This method is quite nature - friendly because in the very old day, our ancestors didn’t eat as much as we do today. Because there were no fridges to store foods and the main way to get food is hunting and collecting, our ancestors didn’t have as many meals as we are taking today and even could actively spend days without eating anything at all. When we fast, inside our body, cells will start their cell - fixing process, gen will change its function to increase our longevity and reduce diseases. IF is not just good for weight loss but also good for our overall health and life quality. Until now, I still favor Intermittent Fasting as a way to treat my body, especially after days of excess and out-of-control eating. When I can control my schedule, I prefer to have two main meals, one is around 10 - 11 am and another is at around 4 - 5 pm. Between these two meals, I can take some fruits or seeds as snack if I feel like I really want to eat something. 4.. Eat Clean The goal of this diet is to eat the whole food as much as you can. Cook at homeApply natural ingredientSay no to preservative and coloringMinimize food processingThe nature of Eat Clean is to detox, reducing those toxic impurities which cause negativity and fat on our body and to add more nutrition to our daily diet. After a while applying this diet, I feel my body fresher and more gentle, my skin get brighter and smoothier. In reality, it’s really hard to maintain this diet if you have to go out to work daily and can not cook frequently. But every time you eat out, you can always choose an option with less ingredients. 5. Low - carb I think it is a very popular diet that everyone is already familiar with. There is just one thing you have to focus is to remove sweeten sugar and eliminate “bad - carbs” out of your diet. For me, carbs like rice, bread are not the cause for our gain - weight. Because we eat too much of everything, that’s why we keep gaining weight. So, when we want to lose weight, we have to apply some strict rules. I like to part that we should remove sweeten sugar and processed food but regarding carbs like white rice, after a while observing on my own, , eating proper carbs doesn’t add weight to my body anymore if I maintain a “clean diet”.  At the moment, I don’t have to try so hard as I did in the beginning to “strictly follow a diet” because it really becomes my habits. I don’t like to take sweeten drinks or cakes as I usually did before. I don’t like packaged food anymore. When I go shopping for food, I automatically choose something like vegetables, seeds, fruits or fish as my first picks. My current daily diet is kind of a mix of Intermittent Fasting, Eat Clean and Low - carb (but still eat white rice). And I still have sugar or fast food when I feel like, it’s totally fine to keep at a certain quantity. Besides, I maintain a yoga schedule to stay fresh, flexible and focused. I used to be so obsessed with my measurement and weight and all kind of diets I could think of. I measured myself almost everyday. Everything is okay now, finally. Some of my experiences after “those days”: There is no “best diet” but the most suitable diet to you. If you don’t know it yet, just try some and you'll found one, at last.If you want to be successful, you have to be disciplined in the beginning and be consistent. After a while, it will becomes your habits.Give yourself a break, some “cheat day”, relax and continue. Diet is a long-term plan for your better life quality, not just for weight loss.Eat just enough, don’t overeating or starving yourself.Wish you success on your journey!
